intro: Karangolum zollingeri, commonly known as the Zollinger's karangolum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from deep red to violet. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
